Package com.satvik.cli

This package contains ArgHandler, and all of the classes required by it.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Parser<T>
    This interface provides methods for parsing objects into one another.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArgHandler
    This class parses command line arguments, and enables simple retrieval of flags and arguments.
    Argument
    This class describes a command line argument.
    Flag<T>
    This is the class describing a type of Flag which must be assigned a value.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ArgHandlerException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to ArgHandler.
    ArgumentException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to the parsing of arguments in ArgHandler.
    CannotParseValueOfFlagException
    A CannotParseValueOfFlagException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of flags in ArgHandler.
    FlagException
    This is the superclass of all Exceptions related to the parsing of flags in ArgHandler.
    IncorrectFlagSyntaxException
    This is the class describes Exceptions related to errors in creation of a Flag object.
    InvalidFlagException
    An InvalidFlagException describes the nature of an error on parsing flags in ArgHandler.
    MissingFlagValueException
    An MissingFlagValueException describes the nature of an error on parsing flags in ArgHandler.
    NoArgumentOfRequiredTypeFoundException
    A NoArgumentOfRequiredTypeFoundException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of arguments in ArgHandler.
    NoRemainingArgumentsException
    This is the class describing when no arguments remain in the argument queue in ArgHandler.
    UnknownFlagValueTypeException
    A UnknownFlagValueTypeException describes the nature of an error on parsing values of flags in ArgHandler.

Package com.satvik.cli Description

This package contains ArgHandler, and all of the classes required by it. ArgHandler is a simple argument parsing library, which simplifies the management of command line arguments.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.3, 04/04/2016
Author:
Satvik Saha
